column1: TABLE S27.4 Permitted Variations From a Flat Surface for As-Rolled or Normalized High-Strength Low-Alloy Steel Plates Ordered. to
NoTE I-Permitted Variation From a Flat Surface Along the Length-The longer dimension specified is considered the length
variation from a flat surface along the length shall not exceed the tabular amount for the specified width in plates up to 3700 mm in length
NoTE 2-Permitted Variation From a Flat Surface Across the Width-The permitted variation from a flat surface across the width shall not exceed t
tabular amount for the specified width.
NoTE 3-When the longer dimension is under 900 mm
column2: the permitted variation from a flat surface shall not exceed 10 mm in each direction. Wh

column1: the larger dimension is from 900 to 1800 mm
column3: the permitted variation from a flat surface shall not exceed 75 % of the tabular amount for the specifi

column1: width but in no case less than 10 mm.
NOTE 4--This table and these notes cover the permitted variations from a flat surface for circular and sketch plates
NoTE 5-Permitted variations in waviness do not apply.
NoTE 6-Plates must be in a horizontal position on a flat surface when flatness is measured.
